alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Prince Georges (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 12 at 10:56PM EDT until September 12 at 11:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY AND NORTHWESTERN PRINCE GEORGES COUNTIES... At 1055 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over White Oak, or over Beltsville, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... College Park, Greenbelt, Langley Park, Beltsville, Fairland, White Oak, Adelphi, Colesville, Kemp Mill, Hillandale, Goddard, Wheaton-Glenmont, Silver Spring, Wheaton, Calverton, Cloverly, Burtonsville, Four Corners, and Berwyn Heights. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
